86252053.review:
[h1]ChilloutVR is a very good example of a promising game that has wasted potential: [/h1]

[h1] The negatives [/h1]

[b] 1. It's not beginner friendly. [/b]

Most of the game's players are people that have played during the earlier stages of development (CCK 2.0/3.0). Returning players mostly sit around in one corner of the map, making it harder for newer players to find them.

[b] 2. Talking to people is really repetitive. [/b]

You mostly meet the same people; you (almost) never see new players in this game.

[b] 3. Updates are heavily creator centered. [/b] 

This game's updates are often focused on creation tools and bug fixes that new players aren't going to use.

[b] 4. The lack of public avatars. [/b]

There are little public avatars, which makes it less appealing to people not wanting to create their own avatars.

[b] 5. The performance [/b]

This game's performance (at least in my experience) is very laggy and choppy with constant fps spikes.

[h1] The positives [/h1]

[b] 1. The CCK [/b]

The CCK (Content Creation Kit) is a very simple and easy to use SDK for avatars and worlds, making everything extremely easy to do. 

[b] 2. The community [/b]

Even though it's [i] extremely [/i] small, it's an almost perfect community. I've never seen a toxic person in this game before.

[b] 3. The moderation team [/b]

The mods/admins in this game are very professional and friendly. 

[b] 4. The prop system [/b]

The prop system is GENIUS. It's a very nice touch; not as good as NeosVR's system, but good nonetheless.

[h1] Final verdict [/h1]

[b] Should you play this game? [/b] 

[b] In it's current state? No. [/b] The community is small and the game can be extremely choppy at times, but if you have good hardware you should be fine.

[b] In the future? Probably. [/b] This game still has some potential for growth community and software wise.

In terms of performance it def seems it can handle more complex models easier. Larger worlds will obviously still end up struggling but upcoming updates are already looking into ways of tweaking it. Devs are fairly relaxed but are strict about having people follow rules about tagging your models with the correct tags so others can hide your avatar if it contains something mature. Has some pretty cool exclusive features compared to competitors like the ability to fly around and noclip through worlds (for those that allow it) as well as prop spawning which is already seeing lots of use. The CCK (vrchat sdk equivelent) is fairly similar and any model making skills translate almost perfectly to theirs. Numerous vrchat world creators have already made chillout world versions so there are already worlds available you might be familiar with.

overall, very happy with it. Going to be watching its development VERY closely

86236929.review:
At the time i write this review ChilloutVR is close to Beta release on Steam. 
I saw the developement of this game since November 2019 so i can tell how much work and passion was put into the developement of this game.
Everytime a new update came out i was amazed of the creativity and commitment the Devs showed, be it a requested feature or their own idea.
The Devs really listen to the community instead of abandoning them, like many other game devs do.

[b]My experiences as Player/User:[/b]
I've met some really awesome people in CVR so far and hope to continue finding more, Toxic people are really rare atm, but i bet that the numbers will go up now that it is release in Beta on Steam, the moderation is good and fast so if someone wants to cause trouble i believe they won't be around for long.
Safety features for Avatar Content blocking like Particles,  Audio and much more are already in place and will continue to be improved in the future.
In terms of game crashes i had about 10 crashes in about 1 year i think thats a good record even for games that are already released and finished.

[b]Some things to point out:[/b]
[u]Is ChilloutVR a VRChat ripoff?[/u]
Definitely not, it may be inspired by VRChat, the overall concept is similar, but everything on ChilloutVR is made by themselves nothing is ripped or stolen.

[u]i'm an Avatar/World Creator can i use my Avatars or Worlds from VRChat?[/u]
Yes you can but you need to use different scripts because the VRC "SDK" and the CVR "CCK" are not compatible, nearly all Shaders work as well, also (at this time) CVR uses Unity 2019.

[u]What about Rip protection?!:[/u]
Well thats a big one, while it is nearly impossible to completly protect your assets because people need to download them to display them ingame, CVR does a really good job at protecting all assets. Everything is encrypted and all rip tools that work in VRC are completly useless in CVR.

[u]What is different to other games like this?[/u]
First of all CVR as the Base is more optimized then every other game in this category, but user generated content can always worsen the experience if for example one Avatar is not well optimized.

CVR has some really interesting feature like Spawning your own props that other people can interact with, Interactable Dynamic Bones and Native BHaptic support, just to name a few. (everything is optional and toggable clientside)

The last one i want to point out is the Moderation, Worlds and Avatars are moderated really well. For example a world must be reviewed by a Team member to be publicly available.


So thats it from me, i hope to see you ingame soon and have a nice time what ever you are playing :3

For those that are looking to try this game now that there is a flood of new players.. Be aware server issues will be a thing. They went from maintaining their game with 20 players or so average to having 15,000 new accounts made within the last 48 hrs. They are upgrading their servers and trying to maintain this tide of new players that are incoming. Be patient. It's not easy to manage a growth of 1000-2000% in such a short time. No one could have anticipated this.

As far as everything goes this is just like VRChat, but with a lot of your standard mods built into it. The developers encourage the use and creation of mods that are not malicious. Stealing avatars and content from players is much much more difficult here if not unheard of.

See you guys in ChilloutVR :)

86231396.review:
Ignore most of the negative reviews here, they were made during the launch window in which the game servers got DDOSed and as such had multiple problems.

As someone who has been a part of this community and a member of this game for some time now I can say that the experience that users had at launch is not an accurate representation of what the game has to offer and I urge you to give the game the chance it deserves!
